# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` that wraps a string based on a specified `text_width`. It breaks lines at word boundaries without exceeding the specified width.

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line = isempty(current_line) ? word : current_line * " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the last line

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
input_text = "This is an example text that needs to be wrapped"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(input_text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This code will produce:

```
This is an
example text
that needs to
be wrapped
```
